body.p:
The undersigned would respectfully represent that your Petitioner James Pilant on the day of the Decr term of the Madison Circuit Court 1860 was Convicted by Conffession of Judgment of Keeping a Tipling House. He may have sold liquor contrary to law as much as twice He has been a licensed tavern Keeper for two years past. He sold this liquor after his license for the 1st year ran out and before he renewed for the 2nd year. He was under the impression that his license permitted him to sell for one month after the expiration of his license for the year when he intended to renew for the 2nd year. which was his intention & which he did do. Upon inquiring of the County atty. he found he had done wrong which he deeply regrets. Mr Pilant is a very poor man ^and an old man^ but one of the most honest in our whole county. He has a family to maintain and is ^in feeble health and^ is afflicted with a cancer on his mouth which will we greatly fear destroy his usefulness to his family in the future. We --
earnestly recommend him to your excellency as a proper subject for the interposition of Executive Clemency.

I concur in the pray of the within petition
W. H. Caperton
